title_full: IOTSUS01-BP01 Eliminate unnecessary modules, libraries, and processes
title: Eliminate unnecessary modules, libraries, and processes
description: Optimize software and firmware to reduce device's carbon footprint by eliminating unnecessary modules, libraries, and processes. Minimize firmware size and runtime overhead to reduce energy consumption on constrained devices.

title_full: IOTSUS01-BP02 Use AWS IoT features to optimize network usage and power consumption
title: Use AWS IoT features to optimize network usage and power consumption
description: Use AWS IoT features to optimize network usage and power consumption on devices. Leverage features like persistent sessions, MQTT keep-alive optimization, and message batching to reduce energy used for network communications.

title_full: IOTSUS01-BP03 Use a hardware watchdog to restart your device automatically
title: Use a hardware watchdog to restart your device automatically
description: Use a hardware watchdog to restart your device automatically when it becomes unresponsive. This ensures devices recover from software failures and continue operating efficiently rather than consuming power in a hung state.

title_full: IOTSUS01-BP04 Implement resilient and scalable system behavior for clients communicating with the cloud
title: Implement resilient and scalable system behavior for clients communicating with the cloud
description: Implement resilient and scalable system behavior for clients communicating with the cloud. Use exponential backoff, connection pooling, and efficient reconnection strategies to minimize wasted energy on failed communication attempts.

title_full: IOTSUS02-BP01 Use the Basic Ingest feature in AWS IoT Core
title: Use the Basic Ingest feature in AWS IoT Core
description: Incorporate optimized cloud services in your architecture by using the Basic Ingest feature in AWS IoT Core. Basic Ingest reduces messaging costs and resource usage by routing messages directly to AWS services without the message broker.

title_full: IOTSUS02-BP02 Choose an appropriate Quality of Service(QoS) level
title: Choose an appropriate Quality of Service(QoS) level
description: Choose an appropriate Quality of Service (QoS) level for MQTT communications based on your reliability requirements. Lower QoS levels reduce network traffic and energy consumption when guaranteed delivery is not required.

title_full: IOTSUS03-BP01 Source sustainable components to help reduce environmental harm and encourage eco-friendly IoT products
title: Source sustainable components to help reduce environmental harm and encourage eco-friendly IoT products
description: Pick the right hardware components by sourcing sustainable components to help reduce environmental harm. Consider component recyclability, energy efficiency ratings, and supplier sustainability practices.

title_full: IOTSUS03-BP02 Consider the manufacturing and distribution footprint of your device
title: Consider the manufacturing and distribution footprint of your device
description: Consider the manufacturing and distribution footprint of your device when making hardware decisions. Factor in the environmental impact of component sourcing, assembly processes, and shipping logistics.

title_full: IOTSUS03-BP03 Use benchmarks to help you make a processor choice
title: Use benchmarks to help you make a processor choice
description: Use benchmarks to help you make processor choices that balance performance with energy efficiency. Select processors that provide adequate performance for your workload while minimizing power consumption.

title_full: IOTSUS03-BP04 Optimize your device based on real-world testing
title: Optimize your device based on real-world testing
description: Optimize your device based on real-world testing rather than theoretical specifications. Measure actual power consumption and performance under realistic operating conditions to identify optimization opportunities.

title_full: IOTSUS03-BP05 Use sensors with built-in event detection capabilities
title: Use sensors with built-in event detection capabilities
description: Use sensors with built-in event detection capabilities to reduce processor wake cycles and power consumption. Hardware-based event detection allows the main processor to remain in low-power states until meaningful events occur.

title_full: IOTSUS03-BP06 Use hardware acceleration for video encoding and decoding
title: Use hardware acceleration for video encoding and decoding
description: Use hardware acceleration for video encoding and decoding to reduce energy consumption compared to software-based processing. Hardware codecs are significantly more energy-efficient for video workloads.

title_full: IOTSUS03-BP07 Use HSMs to accelerate cryptographic operations and save power
title: Use HSMs to accelerate cryptographic operations and save power
description: Use Hardware Security Modules (HSMs) to accelerate cryptographic operations and save power. Hardware-based cryptography is more energy-efficient than software implementations while also providing enhanced security.

title_full: IOTSUS03-BP08 Use low-power location tracking
title: Use low-power location tracking
description: Use low-power location tracking technologies appropriate for your accuracy requirements. Consider WiFi positioning, cellular triangulation, or duty-cycled GPS to balance location accuracy with battery life.

title_full: IOTSUS04-BP01 Use energy harvesting technologies to power your device
title: Use energy harvesting technologies to power your device
description: Minimize power usage and wastage by using energy harvesting technologies to power your device. Consider solar, kinetic, thermal, or RF harvesting depending on your deployment environment and power requirements.

title_full: IOTSUS04-BP02 Implement tickless operation and low-power modes
title: Implement tickless operation and low-power modes
description: Implement tickless operation and low-power modes on IoT devices to minimize energy consumption during idle periods. Configure deep sleep states and wake-on-event triggers to maximize battery life.

title_full: IOTSUS04-BP03 Allow applications or software running on devices to dynamically adjust settings based on requirements and available resources
title: Allow applications or software running on devices to dynamically adjust settings based on requirements and available resources
description: Allow applications or software on devices to dynamically adjust settings based on requirements and available resources. Implement adaptive algorithms that scale processing and communications based on battery state and workload demands.

title_full: IOTSUS05-BP01 Create detailed documentation
title: Create detailed documentation
description: Educate users to encourage lower carbon footprint of their devices by creating detailed documentation. Provide guidance on optimal device configuration, power-saving features, and environmentally responsible usage patterns.

title_full: IOTSUS05-BP02 Promote responsible disposal, repairability, and transfer of ownership for IoT devices to minimize environmental impact
title: Promote responsible disposal, repairability, and transfer of ownership for IoT devices to minimize environmental impact
description: Promote responsible disposal, repairability, and transfer of ownership for IoT devices to minimize environmental impact. Design devices for longevity, enable secure device reset for resale, and provide recycling guidance.

title_full: IOTSUS05-BP03 Identify when devices in the field can or should be retired
title: Identify when devices in the field can or should be retired
description: Identify when devices in the field can or should be retired to balance operational efficiency with environmental responsibility. Monitor device health and efficiency to determine optimal replacement timing.
